Articles.Content: Looks awesome! Can't wait to try it out!

Hmmm, well, the nozzle and the extension move at the same time... does that count?

Not if he's talking about a nozzle extension deployment animation. I know that the Kosmos pack had that nailed down. I used that engine all the time.
guys this looks awesome!cant wait to use it.
That looks great blackheart!

Update:

A close up of HG-10B (I really like this engine) Flexible Engine.

https://i.imgur.com/22AxvoZ.pnghttps://i.imgur.com/I6Mr3fV.png

That's the XSM right there.

It can be used... well, as XSM and as an Alternate Service Module.

https://i.imgur.com/qGNSrOb.pnghttps://i.imgur.com/7GLmr7x.png

Decided I'd put RCS with the lower tank, upper one would be LFO.

I'd do the fairings, do a little fiddly widdly with cfgs and I might be done if I haven't forgotten something. For the Service Pack at least.

Edit: The modular tanks are 1.84 and 2.5m in size, they can be used normally, they get covered in the right node placement and again, I'll say this, it is VERY challenging to place them. Unless you use it for other purposes other than XSM

Wallpaper Reference: http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/61/Orion_Service_Module.jpg

Looks good from my own design opinions i would reccomend removing the red (or at the least turning it into a darker pastel red) and to change the tank texture from orange to a gold foil texture or the similar, but to me the tanks just look "too colorful" and bright otherwise great work!

Not if he's talking about a nozzle extension deployment animation. I know that the Kosmos pack had that nailed down. I used that engine all the time.

What might the name of that engine be? I use Kosmos too.

Looks good from my own design opinions i would reccomend removing the red (or at the least turning it into a darker pastel red) and to change the tank texture from orange to a gold foil texture or the similar, but to me the tanks just look "too colorful" and bright otherwise great work!

Welp, they are easily changed, just want to express that it's Kerbodyne's design. Meanwhile, the top of the Engine cluster of Kerbodyne has gray tank color, might use that instead.

Edit: I would like to say thanks to those who support me, those are great motivation!

Of course man! and grey sounds like a good idea hey if you ever need a tester just give me a PM and i'll be there to help

Looks like it's the RD-0146. It's the Russian equivalent of the RL-10.

hey if you ever need a tester just give me a PM and i'll be there to help

Don't worry, I'll do once I finish the configs
As everyone is saying it right now, I am of course will be glad to test too

Just wanted to say how I fail so much, it's 1.50m, not 1.84, I had the wrong measurement all this time but still correct in game. XDD

It's 1.84. Im noob.

Looks great in the SLS photo is the fairing going from 3.75m to 2.5m a procedural fairing? And if so, is that what you plan on making still?

Looks great in the SLS photo is the fairing going from 3.75m to 2.5m a procedural fairing? And if so, is that what you plan on making still?

Yep, well, I could advertise my textures to reduce part count. Muhahahaha. Cause I'll be making 2.5m and 3.75m cover for the XSM. Also, yep, it is PFairing. Working on some configs now actually, maybe also waiting for either two who I asked help with to finish so I can mix and match.

I'll say it's good to have one

Dibs on the #2 fan spot. Unless someone else REALLY wants it, in which case I can do with the #3 fan spot. But not lower than that

- - - Updated - - -

I'll say it's good to have one

Dibs on the #2 fan spot. Unless someone else REALLY wants it, in which case I can do with the #3 fan spot. But not lower than that

Edit Two: Changed tank colors

I know I'm going to sound like an ungrateful pain, but would you be open to reducing the strength of that red color at the bottom of the tank right before the engine? Maybe to the same color as the thin red stripe on the upper part of the tank? The color of the tank bottom just seems very glaring as it is. Please don't take this the wrong way, I really do appreciate how much work goes into making and texturing these models; and your work so far is awesome. I just wanted to give you an outside opinion on it.
Looking sharp, as usual. Can't wait!

Dibs on the #2 fan spot. Unless someone else REALLY wants it, in which case I can do with the #3 fan spot. But not lower than that

- - - Updated - - -

Dibs on the #2 fan spot. Unless someone else REALLY wants it, in which case I can do with the #3 fan spot. But not lower than that

Why did you wrote the same thing twice ?

Edit: I have no idea how to make those 3 fairings be able to get symmetry though...

Are you making them as fairings (like KW's) or as an automatic decoupler fairing like engines?

If the former, then you add three connect nodes spaced equally around the object, set stackSymmetry=2, and make your fairing piece be a 120 degree section.

Also, dibs on #some_low_number fan
That looks fantastic! I can't wait to fly that complete SLS!

Dibs on the #2 fan spot. Unless someone else REALLY wants it, in which case I can do with the #3 fan spot. But not lower than that

- - - Updated - - -

Dibs on the #2 fan spot. Unless someone else REALLY wants it, in which case I can do with the #3 fan spot. But not lower than that

Maybe to the same color as the thin red stripe on the upper part of the tank? The color of the tank bottom just seems very glaring as it is. Please don't take this the wrong way, I really do appreciate how much work goes into making and texturing these models; and your work so far is awesome. I just wanted to give you an outside opinion on it.

Srsly, you are the one who should not think of it the wrong way. Because that's totally fine and not a pain at all. Opinions are totally welcome! I'll change it as soon as I can, so don't worry

Are you making them as fairings (like KW's) or as an automatic decoupler fairing like engines?
